properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-27T08:59:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-27T02:40:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1193062300.2020

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms over Lake Erie will continue moving east early this morning. Conditions continue to be favourable for squalls with wind gusts up to 50 knots and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms. Thunderstorms will move east of Lake Erie later this morning. ### Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-27T16:59:29-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms over Lake Erie will continue moving east and out of the area early this morning. Wind gusts of 35 knots are possible for the next few hours until thunderstorms move east of Lake Erie. ### Proceed with caution as visibility may suddenly be reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event beginning today continuing for about one week. Daytime high temperatures in the low to mid thirties with overnight lows near 20 are expected until the end of next week. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-27T20:05:06-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area. Thunderstorms south of St. Thomas are moving east at 30 knots towards the area. Wind gusts near 40 knots are expected. Another more organized area of thunderstorms is expected to move into the area afterwards which could bring strong wind gusts near 50 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and torrential rain. Hazards: - Wind gusts to 90 km/h. - Torrential downpours leading to flash flooding. Timing: After midnight into early Saturday morning as thunderstorms over Michigan and the Windsor area are expected to move into the area. ### Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-27T16:59:19-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing torrential rain. Hazards: - Heavy rain leading to flash flooding. - Damaging wind gusts Timing: Early this morning. Thunderstorms over Lake Erie continue to move east early this morning. While the threat for thunderstorms reaching severe criteria has diminished for the area, there still remains the potential for heavy rain and strong wind gusts, particularly near the Lake Erie shoreline. ### Strong wind gusts are also possible. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-27T14:59:17-00:00

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. This evening fog is expected to move back into town and persist until Saturday afternoon. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, waterspout activity and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times are expected or occurring in the area. Multiple areas of severe thunderstorms across western Lake Erie are moving east at 30 knots. One area of thunderstorms is south of Chatham and is likely accompanied by wind gusts of 40 knots. An additional line of more organized thunderstorms is extending southwest from Leamington and may be accompanied by wind gusts near 50 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-27T08:52:10-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and torrential rain. ### Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
